messages.message:
I see that we say we support `.gsheets` , `.gslides`, and `.gdocs` , but we don't support Google drive as an upstream integration and you cannot download these files in their native format. I'm assuming that this is only then in the context of Search. However, this is pretty unclear and confusing if you are trying to understand automation limitations. Can someone provide more light here?

cc: @Balaram @Atinder @melissa.amos

@Xindi Xu Is this (at least in some part) related to this discussion (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0572EYQZUY/p1707866771191679) we had ages ago about Google Drive in the file explorer? Where if someone connects Google Drive for input, the native Google file types show in the AI Hub file explorer. (According to that thread they’re converted to PDF upon upload though, not sure I ever wrote that down in the docs though :grimacing:)

But according to the docs (https://docs.instabase.com/admin/data-sources/connect-drives#connecting-google-drive) you cannot add google drive as an upstream integration for a deployment right? So what does it mean to "connect Google Drive for input"?
Users can upload files via the file picker to Projects/Conversations/App runs.

In the way that I wrote it, I was specifically thinking of when you select files from the file explorer. So I guess I meant “When you connect a Google Drive, then later upload files from a connected drive”, such as in a conversation.
Ah okay. This is helpful! So right now its more manual

We should definitely clarify this in the docs though

ETA: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/DOCS-1226
We should also treat .gsheets as spreadsheets natively.. will create an item for this
